snippet: Since a suicide bomber killed seven Jordanian security officials more than a week ago, some 60,000 refugees have not had access to food or medicine....
abstract: Group of at least 60,000 Syrian refugees is living in desert on border between Syria and Jordan, largely deprived of humanitarian aid since suicide bombing forced sealing of border; humanitarian groups predict disaster and call on governments worldwide to take in more refugees.

byline.original: By RANA F. SWEIS and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Rana F. Sweis reported from Amman, Jordan, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Since a suicide bomber killed seven Jordanian security officials more than a week ago, some 60,000 refugees have not had access to food or medicine.

headline.main: Syrians Stranded at Jordan’s Border Struggled to Survive. Then the Water Stopped.
headline.print_headline: In a Desolate Spot, Desperate Syrian Refugees

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
